answers.answer: Hi there,In diabetes mellitus there is increased frequency of urine and diabetics are more prone for UTI. An infectious disease consultation may be helpful in selecting the appropriate antimicrobial agent for you.You will need diagnostic tests like urine analysis, urine culture, ultrasonography, cystoscopy etc. Treatment of underlying cause will be helpful. Seek medical help.Best wishes!

question: I keep getting UTI's.  The doctor said it's just a fact of life when you are diabetic.  How can I prevent them?  D-Mannose does not work for me, I got my last two infections while taking heavy doses of it.  Also can't take cranberry or blueberry, I am on the blood thinner Coumadin and they interfere with the action of it.  Also can't take Alka-Seltzer(which works real well for clearing out a UTI) for the same reason.  I know all about wiping in the proper direction, etc....  It's costing me thousands of dollars a year going to the doctor and I'm fed up with the whole thing.  Can anybody help?
title: What are some natural treatments for UTI's?
